user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_create_response_from_buffer_with_free_callback_cls:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN struct MHD_Response *
MHD_create_response_from_buffer_with_free_callback_cls (size_t size,
                                                        const void *buffer,
                                                        MHD_ContentReaderFreeCallback
                                                        crfc,
                                                        void *crfc_cls)
{
  struct MHD_Response *r;

  if ((NULL == buffer) && (size > 0))
    return NULL;
#if SIZEOF_SIZE_T >= SIZEOF_UINT64_T
  if (MHD_SIZE_UNKNOWN == size)
    return NULL;
#endif /* SIZEOF_SIZE_T >= SIZEOF_UINT64_T */
  r = MHD_calloc_ (1, sizeof (struct MHD_Response));
  if (NULL == r)
    return NULL;
#if defined(MHD_USE_THREADS)
  if (! MHD_mutex_init_ (&r->mutex))
  {
    free (r);
    return NULL;
  }
#endif
  r->fd = -1;
  r->reference_count = 1;
  r->total_size = size;
  r->data = buffer;
  r->data_size = size;
  r->crfc = crfc;
  r->crc_cls = crfc_cls;
  return r;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function MHD_create_response_from_buffer_with_free_callback_cls:
#define _MHD_EXTERN __attribute__((visibility("default")))extern
...
struct MHD_Response
{

  /**
   * Head of double-linked list of headers to send for the response.
   */
  struct MHD_HTTP_Res_Header *first_header;

  /**
   * Tail of double-linked list of headers to send for the response.
   */
  struct MHD_HTTP_Res_Header *last_header;

  /**
   * Buffer pointing to data that we are supposed
   * to send as a response.
   */
  const char *data;

  /**
   * Closure to give to the content reader @e crc
   * and content reader free callback @e crfc.
   */
  void *crc_cls;

  /**
   * How do we get more data?  NULL if we are
   * given all of the data up front.
   */
  MHD_ContentReaderCallback crc;

  /**
   * NULL if data must not be freed, otherwise
   * either user-specified callback or "&free".
   */
  MHD_ContentReaderFreeCallback crfc;

#ifdef UPGRADE_SUPPORT
  /**
   * Application function to call once we are done sending the headers
   * of the response; NULL unless this is a response created with
   * #MHD_create_response_for_upgrade().
   */
  MHD_UpgradeHandler upgrade_handler;

  /**
   * Closure for @e uh.
   */
  void *upgrade_handler_cls;
#endif /* UPGRADE_SUPPORT */

#if defined(MHD_USE_POSIX_THREADS) || defined(MHD_USE_W32_THREADS)
  /**
   * Mutex to synchronize access to @e data, @e size and
   * @e reference_count.
   */
  MHD_mutex_ mutex;
#endif

  /**
   * The size of the response body.
   * Set to #MHD_SIZE_UNKNOWN if size is not known.
   */
  uint64_t total_size;

  /**
   * At what offset in the stream is the
   * beginning of @e data located?
   */
  uint64_t data_start;

  /**
   * Offset to start reading from when using @e fd.
   */
  uint64_t fd_off;

  /**
   * Number of bytes ready in @e data (buffer may be larger
   * than what is filled with payload).
   */
  size_t data_size;

  /**
   * Size of the writable data buffer @e data.
   */
  size_t data_buffer_size;

  /**
   * Reference count for this response.  Free once the counter hits
   * zero.
   */
  unsigned int reference_count;

  /**
   * File-descriptor if this response is FD-backed.
   */
  int fd;

  /**
   * Flags set for the MHD response.
   */
  enum MHD_ResponseFlags flags;

  /**
   * Automatic flags set for the MHD response.
   */
  enum MHD_ResponseAutoFlags flags_auto;

  /**
   * If the @e fd is a pipe (no sendfile()).
   */
  bool is_pipe;

  /**
   * I/O vector used with MHD_create_response_from_iovec.
   */
  MHD_iovec_ *data_iov;

  /**
   * Number of elements in data_iov.
   */
  unsigned int data_iovcnt;
}
...
typedef void
(*MHD_ContentReaderFreeCallback) (void *cls)
...
#define MHD_calloc_(n, s) calloc((n),(s))
...
#define MHD_mutex_init_(pmutex) (!(pthread_mutex_init((pmutex),NULL)))
...
#define SIZEOF_SIZE_T 8
...
#define SIZEOF_UINT64_T 8
...
#define MHD_SIZE_UNKNOWN UINT64_MAX
...
#define MHD_USE_THREADS 1
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
suspicious_frags:
_MHD_EXTERN struct MHD_Response *
MHD_create_response_from_buffer_with_free_callback_cls (size_t size,
                                                        const void *buffer,
                                                        MHD_ContentReaderFreeCallback
                                                        crfc,
                                                        void *crfc_cls)
explanation: Only compiler language extensions explicitly documented as such should be reported for MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2. The code above uses the GCC-style __attribute__((visibility("default"))) construct (via the _MHD_EXTERN macro), which is a compiler extension and therefore warrants investigation. Other constructs in the provided code are standard C or standard library/POSIX APIs and are not compiler language extensions: use of size_t/uint64_t/UINT64_MAX, function-pointer typedefs, const void* to char* assignment, calloc, pthread_mutex_init (wrapped in a macro), preprocessor conditionals (#if/#ifdef), and use of bool (C99 stdbool) are all standard language features or standard library/OS APIs rather than compiler-specific language extensions. These standard constructs do not need to be investigated under Rule 1.2.
